body.p: A Kentucky attorney, farmer, manufacturer, and politician. Attended Cumberland College in Princeton, Kentucky. Pursued farming and manufactured iron near Eddyville, Kentucky. Married thrice, first Margaret Aurelia Lyon Machen, a second time to Eliza W. Dobbins Machen, and a third time to Victoria Theresa Mims Machen. Father of Mary J. Machen, Henry L. Machen, Edward Chittenden Machen, Willis B. Machen, John S. Machen, Mary E. Machen, Elizabeth Machen, Minerva Buckner Machen Sayre, Frank Machen, Charles B. Machen, and Willis B. Machen. Served as a member of the 1849 Kentucky Constitutional Convention from Lyon County, Kentucky. Served as a member of the Kentucky Senate in 1854. Served as a member of the Kentucky House of Representatives from 1856 to 1860. Served as a member of the Council of Ten in the Provisional Government of Kentucky. Served the First Kentucky District as a member of the First and Second Confederate Congresses from 1862 to 1865.
